title: 114_hr1504
content:
The Act titled "Reducing Federal Mandates on School Lunch Act" prohibits regulations that establish certain limits for the school lunch program. The Act prohibits the implementation of certain regulations related to calorie limits and food quantities in the school lunch program until a law extending program authorization is enacted. Section 9(f) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to set limits on sodium levels in federally reimbursed meals, foods, and snacks sold in schools. The Secretary is required to maintain sodium levels above Target 1 and only half of all grains must be whole grain-rich. The new rule requires snacks sold in schools to be whole grain-rich, and school food authorities must comply with the grain component standards in effect before July 1, 2014. SEC. 4. PROHIBITION OF OTHER NUTRITION REGULATIONS FOR CERTAIN SCHOOL FOOD AUTHORITIES. Prohibition on implementing nutrition regulations for school food authorities until certain conditions are met. The regulations prohibit the Secretary of Agriculture from defining costs of compliance for school food authorities. The rules include nutrition standards for all foods sold in schools as required by the Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act of 2010. The regulations under the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 include provisions related to school lunch price increases and establishing new food-based meal patterns for the school breakfast program. SEC. 5. RULES OF CONSTRUCTION.

The Secretary of Agriculture is not prohibited from implementing, administering, or enforcing rules or regulations not described in this Act, or parts 210 and 220 of title 7, Code of Federal Regulations.
